required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effectiveness of a Topical Palmitoylethanolamide (PEA) Formulation (Levagen+) for Reducing Symptoms of Eczema
clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of a Topical Palmitoylethanolamide Formulation (Levagen+) for Reducing the Symptoms of Eczema Versus a Comparator

brief_summary.textblock: This is a double blind, randomised, non-clinical study with 2 groups (1 investigational group and 1 comparator group) aiming to assess the effectiveness of PEA for reducing eczema severity compared to a base comparator moisturiser in healthy adults aged over 18 years.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline prior to commencement, Week 2 and Week 4
primary_outcome.description: Change in eczema area and severity index (SA-EASI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in itchiness (pruritus numerical rating scale)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline prior to commencement, Week 2 and Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Change in self-reported itchiness (pruritus numerical rating scale). Minimum value = 0, no pruritus. Maximum value = 10, Very severe pruritus.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline prior to commencement, Week 2 and Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Change in self-reported topical anti-inflammatory use

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient eczema self assessment (Patient Orientated Eczema Measure)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline prior to commencement, Week 2 and Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement in POEM. Minimum value 0 - clear or almost clear, Maximum value 28 - Very severe eczema

arm_group.description: Investigational product will be provided as a topical cream containing 1.5% PEA and participants will be asked to apply to their affected site 2-3 times daily for 4 weeks. Cream should be applied liberally (as you would a moisturiser cream) such to coat the affected area and absorb into the skin.

A comparator placebo moisturiser cream (an unscented moisturizing base cream) will be provided and applied in the same manner as the active ingredient group. Participants will be asked to apply to their affected site 2-3 times daily for 4 weeks. Cream should be applied liberally (as you would a moisturiser cream) such to coat the affected area and absorb into the skin.

intervention.description: A topical cream containing 1.5% PEA applied to the affected site 2-3 times daily, liberally to coat and cover affected area.
A comparator placebo topical moisturiser cream (an unscented moisturising base cream) applied to the affected site 2-3 times daily, liberally to coat and cover affected area.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults (over 18)
- Suffering from atopic eczema with symptoms of redness, dry skin, scaling and/or itchiness on hands or arms
- Otherwise healthy
- Able to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active allergic skin responses
- Unstable or serious illness (eg kidney, liver, GIT, heart conditions, diabetes, mood disorders, cancer)
- Use of immunosuppressive medication within the last 3 months
- Pregnant or lactating women
- Smokers
- Chronic past and/or current alcohol use (>14 alcoholic drinks week)
- Allergic to any of the ingredients in active or comparator formula
- An unstable illness is any illness that is currently not being treated with a stable dose of medication or is fluctuating in severity. A serious illness is a condition that carries a risk of mortality, negatively impacts quality of life and daily function and/or is burdensome in symptoms and/or treatments.
